text:
Q: How should ground-truth and tracker result files be structured for TrackEval? A:

Folder structure

.
├── gt
│   └── seq
│       ├── gt
│       │   └── gt.txt
│       ├── seqinfo.ini
│       └── seqmaps
│           └── seq.txt
└── trackers
    └── mytracker
        └── data
            └── seq.txt

seqinfo.ini

[Sequence]
name=seq
imDir=img1
frameRate=30
seqLength=1620
imWidth=1080
imHeight=720
imExt=.jpg

seqmaps/seq.txt

seq

Example evaluation code

import trackeval

eval_config = trackeval.Evaluator.get_default_eval_config()

dataset_config = trackeval.datasets.MotChallenge2DBox.get_default_dataset_config()
dataset_config.update({
    'GT_FOLDER': './video_number/gt',
    'TRACKERS_FOLDER': './video_number/trackers',
    'TRACKERS_TO_EVAL': ['mytracker'],
    'SEQ_INFO': {
        'seq': None  # auto-read from seqinfo.ini
    },
    'SKIP_SPLIT_FOL': True
})

metrics_config = {
    'METRICS': ['HOTA', 'CLEAR', 'Identity'],
    'THRESHOLD': 0.5
}

evaluator = trackeval.Evaluator(eval_config)
dataset = trackeval.datasets.MotChallenge2DBox(dataset_config)

metrics = [
    trackeval.metrics.HOTA(metrics_config),
    trackeval.metrics.CLEAR(metrics_config),
    trackeval.metrics.Identity(metrics_config)
]

summary = evaluator.evaluate([dataset], metrics)
print(summary)

Notes

  • gt.txt and tracker result files must start at frame 1, not frame 0.

  • Do not change the folder names except for seq and mytracker and must be changed consistently everywhere in the code.

  • If you encounter NumPy 2.0 compatibility issues, apply the patch below before importing TrackEval.

import numpy as np

if not hasattr(np, 'float'):
    np.float = float

if not hasattr(np, 'int'):
    np.int = int

Q: how to implement recaptcha in react native app? A:

To use reCAPTCHA v3 (score-based, invisible to the user) in a React Native app, you should use the official Google library:

npm install @google-cloud/recaptcha-enterprise-react-native
# or
yarn add @google-cloud/recaptcha-enterprise-react-native

This library is provided by GoogleCloudPlatform and is a React Native wrapper around the reCAPTCHA Enterprise Mobile SDK for iOS & Android. It supports reCAPTCHA v3 style scoring and token generation in native mobile environments. (GitHub)

Basic usage:

import {
  Recaptcha,
  RecaptchaAction,
  type RecaptchaClient,
} from '@google-cloud/recaptcha-enterprise-react-native';

const client = await Recaptcha.fetchClient(SITE_KEY);
const token = await client.execute(RecaptchaAction.LOGIN());

You can then verify the token on your backend as usual with reCAPTCHA Enterprise. (GitHub)

This is the correct way to integrate reCAPTCHA v3 / Enterprise in React Native instead of trying to use a pure web library.

Q: Logging long running API or other call A:

I'm not sure if it has already been proposed in part by one of the other answers. However, unless you want the log message to appear exactly at the time of the threshold, you can simply start a Stopwatch before the request. After the request is successful or failed, you log if Elapsed is more than the threshold.

Q: How to hide printf mesages in c++? A:

What you want to achieve is not possible using the features provided by the C++ standard library. It does not allow you to change or overwrite previously printed output.

However, most platforms do provide such features as an extension. For example, on Linux, you can use the ncurses library. On Microsoft Windows, you can use SetConsoleCursorPosition or WriteConsoleOutput. Console Virtual Terminal Sequences may work on both platforms.

Q: Using custom icon within pInputText in primeng A:

JUST ADD THIS LINE:

icon="pi pi-calendar"

or any other icon
